item.title: Do you know How to Read a Book?
item.description: Reading something without writing about it or discussing it - helpful proxies for ensuring that you understood what you read and have assessed it independently - is like swallowing your food without having chewed it, first. Perhaps you have read a book and excitedly started telling a friend about it, only to struggle to distill what it was about and what it said, or to realize that you didnâ€™t understand or believe the argument as much as you thought you did.
